intro: Eremosis pugana, commonly known as the Pugana eremosis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, and it produces small yellow to orange flowers. Eremosis pugana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
